translation.en: [announcer] This is the Mutual Broadcasting System.
[newscaster] Fresh details of a Europe in turmoil.
translation.ko: 혼란에 빠진 유럽 소식을 자세히 전해드립니다

translation.en: [announcer] This is the BBC Home Service.
[Winston Churchill] Upon this battle depends the survival of civilization.
[commentator] Peace or war is now in the lap of the gods.
translation.ko: 신의 판단에 따라 평화와 전쟁이 갈릴 것입니다

translation.en: [Franklin Roosevelt] We believe that the Nazis and the fascists have asked for it
translation.ko: 현 상황은 나치와 파시스트가 자초한 것이며

translation.en: and they're going to get it.
[narrator] This is the story of World War II.
What it was really like.
We'll put you on an aircraft carrier when the kamikazes strike.
translation.ko: 카미카제 특공대가 항공모함을 습격할 당시의 모습부터

translation.en: Take you inside a tank with the Nazis' Panzer Division.
translation.ko: 나치 기갑사단 탱크의 내부도 들여다보게 될 것입니다

translation.en: You'll ride with the American GIs for the liberation of Paris.
translation.ko: 파리 해방을 위해 미군과 함께 달리고

translation.en: And with the Soviet Red Army for the final assault on Berlin.
translation.ko: 소련의 붉은 군대와 함께 베를린 공방전에 뛰어들 겁니다

translation.en: This is the true story of the biggest conflict in human history.
translation.ko: 인류 역사상 가장 큰 갈등의 진실만을 담았습니다

translation.en: This is World War II from the frontlines.
[soldier] Flame thrower, break off.
LEISURE ACTIVITIES
[narrator] 1939.
Germany is ruled by Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler.
translation.ko: 독일은 나치 독재자인 아돌프 히틀러가 장악했습니다

translation.en: He believes his people are a superior race,
destined to conquer Europe.
His armies have already walked into Austria and Czechoslovakia.
translation.ko: 독일군은 이미 오스트리아와 체코슬로바키아에 들어섰습니다 "체코슬로바키아 오스트리아"

translation.en: But the Second World War begins when he invades Poland.
translation.ko: 하지만 제2차 세계대전은 폴란드 침공으로 시작됐죠

translation.en: A task that falls first to the German Air Force, the Luftwaffe.
translation.ko: 독일 공군인 루프트바페가 이 침공 작전을 개시합니다

translation.en: [Bob in German] I was proud to be squadron leader at 23.
We thought Germany was doing something great.
The world would sit up and take notice!
[Kulski] There was a terrible noise and the trees started bending.
And right over the treetops came out
huge black airplanes with crosses.
translation.ko: 십자가를 단 커다란 검정 비행기가 지나갔죠

translation.en: They seemed like hundreds of them.
They were flying to bomb Warsaw.
There was just complete chaos.
People running away.
We just laid down. I was really terrified.
translation.ko: 우린 그냥 수그리고 있었어요 완전히 겁에 질렸었죠

translation.en: [announcer] Please stand by for a very important announcement.
translation.ko: 곧 중대 발표가 있을 예정이니 주의를 기울여 주시기 바랍니다

translation.en: Germany has invaded Poland and has bombed many towns.
translation.ko: 독일이 폴란드를 침공하고 여러 마을을 폭격했습니다

translation.en: [Hitler in German] Already, endless columns of Polish troops have been captured.
Poland asked for this fight.
Now Poland is getting a fight.
[narrator] After three weeks,
the Polish capital, Warsaw, falls to the German army.
translation.ko: 폴란드 수도인 바르샤바는 독일군의 수중에 떨어졌습니다

translation.en: [man in Polish] Hello, hello. Can you hear us?
This is our last radio announcement.
German troops have entered Warsaw.
[Kulski] I remember seeing the dead horses and the ruined buildings.
Our house didn't have any windows left.
It was the same house, but it wasn't.
My mother bursts crying and she threw up
when she saw everything that was happening.
It was just such a shock.
[woman] We were simply overwhelmed by the German military might.
translation.ko: 폴란드는 독일군의 전력에 압도되고 말았어요 "야니나 다비트 폴란드 시민"

translation.en: The sort of feeling developed that we were helpless.
translation.ko: 아무것도 할 수 없다는 무력감에 휩싸였어요

translation.en: It was a feeling of being in a trap. There was no way out.
translation.ko: 덫에 걸린 기분이었죠 빠져나갈 곳이 없었어요

translation.en: I think people simply didn't want to accept it.
And then very gradually but relentlessly, it started to happen.
translation.ko: 그러다 천천히 하지만 혹독하게 직시하게 됐죠

translation.en: [narrator] There's something dark happening in occupied Poland.
[Kulski] The Germans started the terror immediately.
translation.ko: 독일은 입성 즉시 잔혹한 일을 벌였어요

translation.en: They brought in the Orthodox rabbi
and tied him up to the roof of the wooden synagogue
and started a fire
and made the elders run in to try to save him.
And they all died right in front of my eyes.
translation.ko: 그렇게 제 눈앞에서 모두 죽고 말았어요

translation.en: The Germans made it very clear
that it was a question of time that they were going to kill us all.
translation.ko: 곧 잡혀 죽으리란 게 자명한 상황이었죠

translation.en: So we had to defend ourselves. We had to defend our families.
translation.ko: 우린 자신과 가족을 스스로 지켜야 했어요

translation.en: And that was when I decided to join the Polish resistance.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 폴란드 저항군에 들어가기로 했죠

translation.en: [narrator] Julian Kulski is still only a schoolboy.
But soon he will learn what it means to kill a man.
translation.ko: 하지만 얼마 안 가 살인하는 법을 배우게 됩니다

translation.en: But from Germany, the war looks very different.
translation.ko: 하지만 전쟁을 대하는 독일의 시선은 매우 달랐습니다

translation.en: [Werk in German] For many of us, being a decent German
translation.ko: 우리는 대부분… "한스 베르크 히틀러 청소년단" 진정한 독일인이라면

translation.en: meant being a member of the Nazi party.
We were the good guys.
[Werk] Hitler was there for us.
He was our Führer, sent by God.
[soldiers in German] Here we stand.
We are ready
to carry Germany into a new era.
One people,
one Führer,
one Reich!
[narrator] Hitler's plan is to create a German empire by invading countries to the east.
translation.ko: 히틀러는 동쪽으로 세를 넓혀 독일 제국을 세울 계획입니다

translation.en: But Great Britain and France have a pact with Poland.
translation.ko: 하지만 영국과 프랑스는 폴란드와 조약을 체결했습니다 "영국, 프랑스"

translation.en: So they now declare war on Germany.
translation.ko: 이에 두 나라는 독일에 전쟁을 선포하죠

translation.en: [announcer] Just to bring you up to date on the news of Europe,
if you are just turning on your radios:
Great Britain is now at war with Germany.
[announcer 2] Every minute spent on production now
is vital to the defense of the country and your homes.
translation.ko: 조국과 가정을 지키는 데 꼭 필요할 것입니다

translation.en: In Paris and London, they're sending children to the safety of the countryside.
translation.ko: 파리와 런던에서는 아이들을 안전한 시골로 보냅니다

translation.en: [man in French] We are determined not to submit to threats of violence.
translation.ko: 폭력의 위협에는 절대로 굴하지 않을 것입니다

translation.en: [narrator] France and Britain are calling up their colonial armies for support
from Asia and Africa.
[man in French] In a world of masters and slaves,
we must save liberty and dignity.
Allied troops spread out along the Maginot Line,
a network of bunkers and fortresses along the German border.
translation.ko: 독일 국경 근처 참호와 요새의 통신도 강화했죠

translation.en: For eight months, the two sides eyeball each other across the line.
[announcer in German] The first phase of this great fight is over.
translation.ko: 이 위대한 전투의 첫 국면이 종료됐습니다

translation.en: And what we did in Poland will be fulfilled in England and France!
[narrator] Spring 1940.
The Germans launch a surprise attack.
They go around the Maginot Line, through the Ardennes Forest.
[Heinlein in German] My friends had fought in Poland,
translation.ko: 폴란드로 간 전우들처럼 저도 빨리 싸우고 싶었어요

translation.en: and I wanted to see action.
translation.ko: 폴란드로 간 전우들처럼 저도 빨리 싸우고 싶었어요 "발터 하인라인 독일군"

translation.en: I was thrilled.
[narrator] The Panzers pour into Belgium,
the Netherlands, and France.
[Heinlein] We were surprised there was hardly any resistance.
translation.ko: 저항다운 저항을 못 봐서 꽤 놀랐어요

translation.en: [woman] The day they arrived, I remember, I was afraid.
translation.ko: 독일군이 도착한 날 전 겁에 질렸었어요

translation.en: My mother said, "Things are going to get very bad, very bad."
translation.ko: 어머니는 상황이 무척 나빠질 거라고 하셨죠

translation.en: They were arresting young people on the street.
translation.ko: 독일군은 거리의 젊은이들을 모두 체포해 버렸어요

translation.en: And you never saw them again.
It was terrible.
[Heinlein] Then the British came in their little armored vehicles.
translation.ko: 이후 영국군이 작은 장갑차를 몰고 왔어요

translation.en: They were so outdated.
With one shot they were in a ditch.
[narrator] The British fall back to the beaches of Dunkirk,
cornered by the Germans.
They're trapped and defenseless.
[Hunn] We'd got to Dunkirk.
Then suddenly out of the sky would come these airplanes.
translation.ko: 하늘에서 갑자기 비행기 한 무더기가 나타났어요

translation.en: They're screaming, and they would dive on these men and machine-gun them.
You could do nothing about it.
What terror!
[narrator] With their backs to the wall, the British mount a last-ditch evacuation.
translation.ko: 궁지에 몰린 영국은 최후의 철수 작전을 실행합니다

translation.en: [announcer] Near Dunkirk this evening, Allied troops have been deliberately machine-gunned
translation.ko: 오늘 저녁, 됭케르크 인근에선 연합군이 무방비 상태로

translation.en: and slaughtered by low-flying aircraft.
Allied hospital ships have been attacked.
[Hunn] You're up to your neck. Dead bodies.
The slaughter.
Then somebody pulled me up.
I looked out, and there in front of you
was the whole of Dunkirk.
Massive flames, smoke, explosions.
translation.ko: 사방이 연기와 불바다였고 폭발이 끊이지 않았어요

translation.en: And you think, that's hell.
[announcer] …and how the Royal Navy, using nearly a thousand ships,
has brought back nearly 350,000 men.
[narrator] The British Army scrambles home
and lives to fight another day.
[Hunn] We arrived back home at Margate.
I felt rather ashamed.
Because I knew that there was hordes of Germans
on the other side of the channel.
DUNKIRK
[narrator] In the space of a few weeks,
the German army has killed or captured more than two million Allied troops.
It takes the Nazis 21 days to take the rest of France and roll into Paris.
translation.ko: 나치가 프랑스에 들어가 파리를 점령하는 데는 21일이 걸렸죠

translation.en: [commentator] France has surrendered.
[commentator 2] Britain alone will continue the struggle.
translation.ko: 영국은 홀로 전쟁을 끌어 나갈 것입니다

translation.en: [narrator] In Berlin, Hitler gets a hero's welcome.
The Nazis now control much of Europe.
Only Great Britain stands in their way.
But Prime Minister Winston Churchill is defiant.
translation.ko: 하지만 윈스턴 처칠 총리는 굴하지 않습니다

translation.en: [Churchill] We are in one of the greatest battles in history.
You ask, what is our policy?
It is to wage war by sea, land and air
with all the strength that God can give us.
translation.ko: 육해공 가리지 않고 전쟁을 지속할 것입니다

translation.en: Victory at all costs.
Without victory, there is no survival.
[narrator] Hitler is preparing the final knockout blow,
a full-scale invasion of Great Britain.
But first, he must take down the British Royal Air Force.
translation.ko: 하지만 이를 위해선 영국 공군부터 제압해야 합니다

translation.en: [Wellum] Somebody gave me this… lithe-looking creature called a Spitfire
translation.ko: 누군가 제게… "제프리 웰럼 왕립공군" 스핏파이어라는 잘 빠진 기체를 넘겨주면서

translation.en: and said, "There's a Spitfire, go and fly it."
The ground crew were waiting for me and told me how to start the thing.
translation.ko: 대기하던 지상 팀이 시동 거는 법을 알려줬어요

translation.en: The next thing I knew, it had leapt into the air.
translation.ko: 그러고 정신을 차려보니 하늘로 날아오르고 있었어요

translation.en: Sort of me hanging on to it, really…
and off we went into the wild blue yonder.
[narrator] Geoffrey Wellum is a Spitfire pilot just out of training.
translation.ko: 제프리 웰럼은 갓 훈련을 마친 스핏파이어 파일럿입니다

translation.en: He's one of just over a thousand young men
who now carry the fate of the war on their shoulders.
[Wellum] I remember thinking, "Oh, my goodness me."
And you offered up a little prayer.
"It's going to be a very busy day, O Lord."
translation.ko: '주여, 오늘은 바쁜 하루가 될 것 같습니다'

translation.en: "If I forget you, don't you forget me."
translation.ko: '제가 주를 잊더라도 저를 잊진 말아 주소서'

translation.en: "Just give me this day."
"Please give me this day."
[narrator] Across the English Channel,
the German pilots gather for a final briefing.
translation.ko: 독일 파일럿들이 최종 브리핑을 듣고 있습니다

translation.en: [Bob] The campaigns in Poland and France
gave us a lot of experience
so we were ready.
The English knew we were better pilots.
translation.ko: 당시 영국조차 우리 파일럿들이 더 우수하다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [Wellum] One got a little bit angry.
What were they doing over here?
They've decimated Europe, flattened Poland.
And here they are over this country.
You know, what right have they got to do this sort of thing?
translation.ko: 자기들이 뭐라고 이런 짓을 벌이는 거죠?

translation.en: [Churchill] We shall fight on the seas and oceans.
translation.ko: 우린 바다와 대양에서 싸울 것입니다 "윈스턴 처칠의 목소리"

translation.en: We shall fight with growing confidence and growing strength in the air.
translation.ko: 우린 자신감과 용기를 안고 공중에서 싸울 것입니다

translation.en: We shall defend our island, whatever the cost may be.
translation.ko: 무슨 대가를 치르든 우리 땅을 지켜낼 것입니다

translation.en: We shall fight on the beaches.
We shall fight in the fields and in the streets.
We shall never surrender.
[Bob] We had always seen the English as brothers,
but as soon as the shooting started,
it was us or them.
[Wellum] We went up through a little bit of cloud.
And I looked ahead.
There they were.
I've never seen so many airplanes in the sky at one time.
translation.ko: 상공에 그렇게 많은 전투기가 떠있는 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: We were heading towards them at 300 miles an hour.
translation.ko: 우린 시속 500km 정도로 독일군을 향해 날아갔죠

translation.en: They were coming towards us at 300 miles an hour.
translation.ko: 독일군도 같은 속도로 우릴 향해 날아왔어요

translation.en: That's 600 miles an hour.
The next thing I knew, we went straight into them.
It was just flying for your life.
You see aircraft on fire.
Aircraft breaking up.
People bailing out and their parachutes don't open.
translation.ko: 파일럿들은 비상 탈출을 했지만 낙하산이 펴지지 않았죠

translation.en: It was total war.
[narrator] For 12 weeks, the RAF and the Luftwaffe battle it out.
By the end of September,
1,600 German aircraft have been brought down.
[Bob] The losses were so huge.
The whole mission had to be aborted.
And the Battle of Britain came to an end.
[narrator] For now, Britain is safe from invasion.
[Wellum] The important thing was that we stopped them
translation.ko: 이 전투의 시사점은 우리가 독일을 멈춰 세우고

translation.en: and denied them their aim.
For the first time,
the Germans realized they had suffered a setback.
And they didn't like it.
[in Italian] Hail the Duce!
[in Italian] We are going to battle against the democracies of the West.
translation.ko: 우린 서방 민주주의 국가와 전쟁에 돌입합니다

translation.en: Run to your weapons…
to show your tenacity…
your courage
and your valor!
[narrator] Hitler isn't the only dictator casting a shadow over Europe.
translation.ko: 유럽에 마수를 뻗친 독재자는 히틀러뿐만이 아니었습니다

translation.en: Italy has its own strongman, Benito Mussolini.
translation.ko: 이탈리아에도 독재를 휘두르는 베니토 무솔리니가 있었죠

translation.en: He's plotting a deal with Hitler
and planning military adventures of his own.
[Mussolini] Italy is standing strong, proud and united as never before.
[narrator] With the Brits fighting Germany,
Mussolini takes his chance
and invades British-controlled Egypt.
It took five days for the Axis troops from Agedabia to Derna.
[narrator] Meanwhile, back in Europe,
thousands of Allied soldiers are now prisoners of war.
translation.ko: 연합국 병사 수천 명이 포로로 붙잡혔습니다

translation.en: One of them is Pham Van Kiem,
a Vietnamese soldier serving with the French army.
[Kiem in French] Once we got into the camp…
in the barracks, there were many prisoners of all races.
translation.ko: 포로가 무척 많았는데 인종이 참 다양했어요

translation.en: Senegalese, Algerians, Moroccans, Tunisians, from all over.
[narrator] The Nazis begin to separate colonial soldiers
from other prisoners of war.
[Kiem] After shaving our heads,
we were all given numbers.
I didn't understand why.
[narrator] The Nazis are conducting so-called medical research
translation.ko: 나치는 의학 연구란 이름으로 자신들의 인종주의를 발전시킬

translation.en: to advance their racist beliefs.
And this is just the beginning.
Back in occupied Poland,
they are segregating the Jewish population
inside areas of cities and towns known as ghettos.
LIVING SPACE FOR JEWS DO NOT ENTER
To fight back, 13-year-old Julian Kulski has decided to join the Polish resistance.
translation.ko: 이에 13세인 율리안 쿨스키는 폴란드 저항군에 들어갔습니다

translation.en: [Kulski] At first I was just the runner,
carrying messages through a secret underground passage.
translation.ko: 비밀 지하통로로 다니며 각종 소식을 전달했죠

translation.en: Later on, my captain taught me how to fight,
how to kill a person with a knife or with your hands.
translation.ko: 칼이나 맨손으로 사람 죽이는 법을 알려줬어요

translation.en: [narrator] Julian's unit prepare for resistance against the occupiers.
But their operation is uncovered by the Nazis.
[Kulski] Somehow the Germans learned about my commander.
translation.ko: 독일이 우리 지휘관의 정보를 귀신같이 알아낸 거예요

translation.en: And the Germans arrested him
and shot him point-blank.
He was everything.
I loved that man.
And I just swore that I would revenge him.
translation.ko: 전 꼭 지휘관의 복수를 하겠다고 맹세했어요

translation.en: I and another boy spent the whole day looking for Germans.
translation.ko: 전 다른 소년과 함께 종일 독일인을 찾아다녔어요

translation.en: We found downtown a German soldier.
He started pulling out his gun.
And we both fired.
He fell on his face.
My initial reaction was, you were able to kill them.
They were human.
Next day, they killed 20 women and children on that spot.
translation.ko: 다음 날, 독일군은 그곳에서 여성과 아이 20명을 죽였어요

translation.en: 'Cause for every German,
there were 20 civilians shot on the same place.
It was medieval.
I feel responsible for the death of these poor people.
translation.ko: 그 불쌍한 사람들의 죽음에 책임을 느낍니다

translation.en: [narrator] In the ghettos, they'll soon begin to round up Polish Jews
and deport them to camps.
As for the rest of Poland,
the Nazis have plans for them too.
[Twardecki in German] One day, a troop of SS guards came.
translation.ko: 어느 날, SS 대원이 무더기로 몰려왔어요

translation.en: Our mothers were told
there was no food in Poland,
so they wanted to care for us at a children's camp.
translation.ko: 우리를 아동 수용소로 보내 보살피겠다고 했어요

translation.en: I remember being torn from her arms
translation.ko: 그렇게 절 엄마 품에서 강제로 떼어낸 후

translation.en: and put onto a train.
On the side, it said: "Polish children for nourishment of the Reich."
translation.ko: 벽면엔 이런 게 붙어있었어요 '제국을 살찌울 폴란드 아이'

translation.en: [narrator] Alojzy Twardecki is one of 20,000 Polish children abducted by the SS.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 납치된 아이가 2만 명 가까이 됩니다

translation.en: [Twardecki] The color of the eyes, the hair… those were weeded out.
They called me "little angel."
I had curly hair then, very, very blond.
translation.ko: 당시 제 머리는 곱슬거렸고 완벽한 금발이었어요

translation.en: And light blue eyes.
And then, Germanization began.
I felt like a German boy.
translation.ko: 전 꼭 독일인이 된 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Hitler] My German youth, we want to be one people.
translation.ko: 친애하는 독일 청년들이여 우린 하나가 돼야 합니다

translation.en: And you, my youth,
are to be this people…
because you are the flesh of our flesh and the blood of our blood.
translation.ko: 그대의 살은 우리의 살이며 그대의 피는 우리의 피입니다

translation.en: And in your young heads burns the same spirit that rules us.
translation.ko: 그리고 우리와 같은 열망을 그대들은 품어야 합니다

translation.en: Before us Germany lies, in us Germany burns,
translation.ko: 우리 앞엔 독일이 있고 우리 안엔 독일이 함께하며

translation.en: and behind us Germany follows!
[narrator] The scale of Hitler's ambition is now clear.
He dreams of creating a 1,000-year Reich,
homeland to a single master race.
translation.ko: 천 년 제국의 건립을 꿈꾸는 겁니다

translation.en: Now German bombs are falling again on British cities
translation.ko: 독일의 폭격기가 다시 영국을 노리기 시작했고

translation.en: in a new terror campaign.
[announcer] German aircraft carried out a number of attacks on Great Britain.
translation.ko: 간밤에 독일 항공기가 영국 본토를 수차례 공습했고

translation.en: The raid was scattered over many parts of the country.
[narrator] Meanwhile, Fascist Italy has invaded neighboring Greece.
translation.ko: 한편, 파시스트 이탈리아는 이웃 그리스를 침공했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Troops are moving forward
after breaking through the weak Greek resistance.
[narrator] And beyond Europe, war is spreading.
translation.ko: 전쟁의 불길은 다른 곳으로 번지고 있습니다

translation.en: Japan is on a mission to build a so-called new order in Asia.
translation.ko: 일본도 '동아 신질서'란 이름 아래 움직이기 시작합니다

translation.en: They're already at war with China.
[Tojo in Japanese] Our Empire has entered the next stage of cooperation in a New World Order!
translation.ko: 제국은 신세계 질서 협력의 다음 단계에 들어섰습니다

translation.en: [narrator] Now Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy and Imperial Japan
translation.ko: 나치 독일과 파시스트 이탈리아 그리고 일본 제국은

translation.en: agree to join forces in a formidable new alliance.
translation.ko: 힘을 모아 강력한 동맹을 맺기로 합니다

translation.en: They're known as the Axis powers.
Their plan is to conquer the entire globe.
But there's one more player to be reckoned with.
translation.ko: 하지만 등장하지 않은 세력이 하나 더 있습니다

translation.en: The Soviet Union has the world's largest army.
translation.ko: 소련은 세계 최대의 병력을 보유한 국가입니다

translation.en: And in Joseph Stalin,
they have a dictator with the ambition to match Hitler's.
translation.ko: 히틀러와 비견될 만큼 거대한 야망을 품었습니다

translation.en: [Stalin in Russian] Our forces are numberless.
The enemy will soon learn this to their cost.
translation.ko: 적은 피를 흘리고 나서야 그 위력을 실감할 겁니다

translation.en: Forward to victory!
[narrator] 1940 has seen the fires of war ignited in Europe.
In 1941, the flames will spread to engulf every corner of the globe.
[announcer] From the NBC news room in New York…
…President Roosevelt said that the Japanese
have attacked the Pearl Harbor from the air.
I'll repeat that.
President Roosevelt says that the Japanese
have attacked Pearl Harbor in Hawaii from the air.
